content.raw:
Currently the scoring system favours continuity and the penalty for skipping a point/making a single mistake in the middle of a complicated manoeuvre can result in a massive loss of points, because the value of the upcoming checkpoints drop. (see rulebook)
I don't really see how this favours a more real-life like solution. If you make a mistake, why does it matter where you made it? This makes us optimise for points, not for actually cool and sophisticated solutions. Is there a chance for the checkpoints to be equally scored and simply penalising skips?
Thanks
